ITA1121C - Elementary Italian Language a.name: ITA1121C - Elementary Italian Language and Civilization II

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Native Spanish Speaker or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Designed for native speakers of Spanish, uses multilingual pedagogies and intercomprehension between Italian and Spanish, allowing for an accelerated pace of learning.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

ITA2201 - Intermediate Italian Language.name: ITA2201 - Intermediate Italian Language and Civilization II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Designed to continue development of language skills at intermediate level, plus a review of grammar and study of syntax, with emphasis on Italian civilization.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Vocabulary building with systematic training in diction and locution. Speeches and oral presentations as well as production and delivery of real-life dialogues.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

ITA3501 - Made in Italy: A Story of Exce.name: ITA3501 - Made in Italy: A Story of Excellence

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ITA 2200

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduces students to the multifaceted world of Italian entrepreneurship from the perspectives of culture, language, narrative, and history. Beneficial for students minoring in Italian.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

ITA3502 - Canta che ti passa!: Italian t.name: ITA3502 - Canta che ti passa!: Italian through Music

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ITA 2200

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Italian language course applies grammatical and linguistic structures, while analyzing cultural norms, through the study of lyrics, songwriters, and singers.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

ITA2200 - Intermediate Italian Language.name: ITA2200 - Intermediate Italian Language and Civilization I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Designed to continue development of language skills at intermediate level, plus a review of grammar, study of syntax, idiomatic expression, extensive readings, and further study of Italian culture.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Modern Italian culture (1920s through today) through literature, film, and mass media.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

ITA1120C - Elementary Italian Language a.name: ITA1120C - Elementary Italian Language and Civilization I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduces the student to Italian culture through the major language skills: listening, speaking, reading and writing. Open only to students with no experience in this language.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applies the linguistic and grammatical principles of Italian through film and television, with an emphasis on modern Italian culture. Taught entirely in Italian.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of skills in composition, with an introduction to Italian culture.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

ITA3620 - Cucina nostra: Italian through.name: ITA3620 - Cucina nostra: Italian through Food

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applies the linguistic and grammatical principles of Italian through the study of food, with an emphasis on modern Italian culture. Taught entirely in Italian.
